title: Authorizes school districts to issue bonds for the purposes of funding alternative and renewable energy sources for school facilities
summary: Authorizes school districts to issue bonds for the purposes of funding alternative and renewable energy sources for school facilities.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3524

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. REILLY, JAFFEE, SPANO, N. RIVERA -- read once and
         referred to the Committee on Education

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the education law, in relation to authorizing school
         districts to issue bonds for the purposes of funding  alternative  and
         renewable energy sources for school facilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section  416  of  the  education  law,  as
    2  amended  by  chapter  687  of  the  laws  of 1949, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    1. A majority of the voters of any school district, present and voting
    5  at any annual or special district meeting, duly convened, may  authorize
    6  such  acts  and  vote such taxes as they shall deem expedient for making
    7  additions, alterations, repairs or improvements, to the sites or  build-
    8  ings belonging to the district, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO PURCHASING,
    9  CONSTRUCTING, INSTALLING OR IMPLEMENTING ALTERNATIVE AND RENEWABLE ENER-
   10  GY  SOURCES  FOR  SCHOOL  FACILITIES,  or for altering and equipping for
   11  library use any former schoolhouse belonging to the district, or for the
   12  purchase of other sites or buildings, or for a change of sites,  or  for
   13  the  purchase  of  land  and buildings for agricultural, athletic, play-
   14  ground or social center purposes, or for the erection of new  buildings,
   15  or  for  building  a bus garage, or for buying apparatus, implements, or
   16  fixtures, or for  paying  the  wages  of  teachers,  and  the  necessary
   17  expenses  of  the  school, or for the purpose of paying any judgment, or
   18  for the payment or refunding of an outstanding bonded  indebtedness,  or
   19  for such other purpose relating to the support and welfare of the school
   20  as they may, by resolution, approve.
   21    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
